content: play socks pattern by charlotte stone stoneknits these socks are an all over colourwork sock pattern which were inspired by the bright and summery crimson sunset` mini skein set from snail yarns i started knitting these socks during a snowfall in switzerland and the bright colours helped feel like i was bringing warmer weather in my daughter when seeing them in creation commented how much the repeating triangle looks like the play button from that well known company that we like to watch our favourite knitting podcasts on hence they become the play socks the pattern has a simple easy to memorise chart and can be used with any five 20g mini skeins or leftovers in any colour combination as long as the colours are contrasting this makes it a perfect scrappy sock project for you to enjoy experimenting and playing with colours 1 pattern copyright charlotte stone stoneknits 2019 for personal use only these socks are knit from the cuff down with a ribbed cuff and a simple short row heel also known as a boomerang heel and has no wraps and turns the instructions are written for 3 different size socks using different stitch counts for small or child medium and large this pattern uses the magic loop circular needle method but can easily be knit with dpns yarn this pattern was created in collaboration with snail yarn the sample shown is knit in size medium and uses yarn from snail yarns mini skein sock gradient set in colourway crimson sunset this set has five 20g mini skeins in yarn that is 75% merino superwash and 25% nylon the colours included were purple yellow dark pink orange and light pink i tried to pair the most contrasting colours together any fingering weight 4 ply sock yarn can be used to create these socks approximately 350m 382 yds in total size small medium or large needle size recommended is whichever size needle obtains the gauge for the colourwork section i would recommend going up a needle size for the colourwork sections to what you normally use to knit non-colourwork socks if you are unsure for example the colour work section was knit on the sample shown with a 2 5mm needle i normally knit plain socks with a 2 25mm needle my foot circumference is 22cm size small foot circumference 18 - 20 5cm or 7 to 8 inches size medium foot circumference 20 5cm 23 5cm or from 8 to 9 25 inches size large foot circumference 23 5 26cm or from 9 25 to 10 5 inches if the foot size you are knitting the sock for is not listed here you could go up or down a needle size to make the sock bigger or smaller length of foot is adjustable according to the foot length you are knitting the sock for gauge for colourwork section small 2 25mm us 1 needles 38sts x 40 rounds 10cm 4 inches medium 2 5mm us 1 5 needles
